method: In a large pot, heat some oil over medium-high heat.
Add the pork shoulder to the pot and cook until browned on all sides. Remove and set aside.
In the same pot, add the onions, garlic, thyme, and rosemary. Cook until the onions are softened.
Add the chicken broth and bring to a simmer.
Return the pork shoulder to the pot. Cover with a lid and transfer to the preheated oven.
Cook for 3 hours, or until the pork is tender and falling apart.
Remove the pork from the pot and shred using two forks.
Return the shredded pork to the pot and add the potatoes and carrots.
Cover and cook for an additional 30 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
Season with salt and pepper to taste before serving.
